document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_purpose: To ensure use of utility programs capable of overriding system and application controls does not compromise information security
control.control_objective: Restrict and tightly control access to utility programs that could potentially bypass or override system and application security controls

iso_27001_definition.official_text: The use of utility programs that can be capable of overriding system and application controls should be restricted and tightly controlled.
key_requirements: Utility programs capable of overriding controls identified
Use of utility programs tightly controlled
Segregation of duty in approval process
Monitoring of utility program installation and use

control_purpose_detail.purpose: Preventive control limiting access to tools that could bypass security controls and compromise system integrity
scope: All utility programs capable of overriding system controls
All utility programs capable of overriding application controls
control_purpose_detail.key_outcome: Utility program access limited to authorized personnel with documented approval and monitoring

utility_programs_definition.description: Utility programs are specialized software capable of performing operations that bypass or override standard system and application controls
utility_programs_definition.risk_profile: Utility programs present significant risk because they can modify system behavior, bypass access controls, access sensitive data or compromise system integrity if misused

prerequisites.description: Before implementing utility program control, foundational requirements must be met

required_prerequisites.description: Complete inventory of systems and installed utility programs
required_prerequisites.rationale: Must know what utility programs exist to control them
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 5.9 - Inventory of information and other associated assets

required_prerequisites.description: Documented access control policy and procedures
required_prerequisites.rationale: Utility program access controlled through broader access control framework
Utility program access assigned based on user roles and needs
Utility programs typically require elevated privileges to operate

implementation_requirements.description: Identify all utility programs capable of overriding system and application controls

identification_process: Inventory all software installed across organisation
Identify programs capable of system configuration modification
Identify programs capable of overriding access controls
Identify programs capable of modifying audit logs
Identify programs capable of escalating privileges
documentation: Create and maintain list of identified utility programs
Document program name, version and function
Document technical capability to override controls
Update list when new programs installed
categorization: Critical utility programs with high-risk capability
Standard utility programs with moderate-risk capability
Development tools used in secure environment
Monitoring and management tools with restricted functionality

implementation_requirements.description: Create documented procedure for requesting and approving access to utility programs

process_requirements: User submits request for utility program access
Request includes business justification for need
Request specifies program, version and intended use
Requester specifies duration of need (temporary or permanent)
Approver determines if request is justified
Approval authority separate from requesting user
segregation_of_duty: Requesting user cannot approve their own request
In smaller organisations, typically approved by IT manager or CISO
Escalation to senior management for critical programs
Clear delegation of approval authority documented
request_documentation: Formal request form or template used
Specific program, version and function identified
Date and time of approval recorded

implementation_requirements.description: Implement controls preventing unauthorized installation of utility programs

installation_controls: Only approved users permitted to install utility programs
Standard users prevented from installing programs (GPO, AppLocker, MDM)
Installation restricted to approved program versions
installation_procedures: Formal process for installing approved programs
Installation performed by authorized technical staff
Installation documented with date, approver and user
Installation verification that program installed correctly
technical_enforcement: Group Policy restrictions on program installation
Mobile Device Management (MDM) policies on devices
Package management systems for controlled deployment
System integrity monitoring detecting unauthorized changes

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Time Limitations on Utility Program Access
implementation_requirements.description: Establish time limitations on temporary utility program access where appropriate

time_limitations: Temporary access granted for specific duration (hours, days, weeks)
Duration justified based on business need
Access automatically removed when duration expires
Permanent access subject to periodic review and approval
implementation_approaches: Scheduled tasks removing access on expiry date
Calendar reminders for access review and removal
Access control lists with expiry dates
Regular removal procedures for expired access
Escalation process for extending access if still needed
justification_documentation: Business case documenting why access is required
Time period justified based on project or task duration

implementation_requirements.description: Ensure utility programs are properly licensed and compliance maintained

licensing_requirements: All utility programs must be properly licensed
license_documentation: License key or activation information recorded
compliance_verification: Regular audit of utility program installations against licenses
Removal of utility programs after license expiry

implementation_requirements.description: Implement monitoring to track installation and use of utility programs

monitoring_activities: Record utility program execution and usage
Alert on suspicious utility program activity
Track privilege elevation from utility programs
logging_requirements: Utility program installations logged with date and user
Utility program execution logged with timestamp
Usage parameters recorded (files accessed, changes made)
Access attempts to unauthorized programs logged
monitoring_tools: System audit logging of program execution
File integrity monitoring for configuration changes
practical_considerations: Monitoring may not be practical for all programs
Focus on programs posing highest risk
Balance between monitoring and system performance

implementation_requirements.description: Establish regular review procedure to validate continued need for utility program access

review_requirements: Annual review of all utility program access required
Each user's access reviewed for continued justification
Review considers whether program still needed
Unused or no longer needed access removed
review_process: Request utility program access be re-justified annually
Review against current business role and responsibilities
Verify program still provides business value
Approve continued access or schedule removal

implementation_requirements.requirement: Remove Access When No Longer Needed
implementation_requirements.description: Implement procedures to remove utility program access when no longer required

removal_triggers: User changes role without utility program need
Periodic review determines access no longer needed
Business justification expires or becomes obsolete
removal_procedures: User confirmed access no longer available
removal_documentation: Record of access removal with date and reason

steps.detail: Conduct inventory and identify all utility programs with system/application control override capability
Create and maintain list of utility programs and their risk profiles
Create documented procedure for requesting and approving utility program access
Define approval authorities separate from requesting users
Deploy technical controls preventing unauthorized utility program installation
Develop standardized request and approval documentation
Deploy logging and monitoring of utility program installation and use
Provide training on utility program control procedures
Audit existing utility program installations against policy
Schedule annual review of utility program access

Segregation of duty implemented between requester and approver
Approval authority for utility program access clearly defined
Technical controls implemented preventing unauthorized installation
Time limitations established for temporary access where appropriate
Software licensing compliance verified and documented
Monitoring of utility program installation and usage implemented
Audit trail of utility program access approvals maintained
Annual review of utility program access conducted
Procedures for access removal when no longer needed documented
Personnel trained on utility program control procedures

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with utility program controls

mistakes.mistake: Lack of request and approval process allowing unauthorized access
mistakes.description: No formal process for requesting and approving utility program access resulting in users having access without documented justification or approval
root_cause: Informal ad hoc approach to utility program access
Assumption that technical staff can be trusted implicitly
Lack of awareness of security risk
mistakes.impact: Unauthorized users may have access to powerful tools, increased risk of misuse or compromise, audit findings of non-compliance
prevention: Establish and enforce formal request and approval process
Require documented business justification for access
Implement segregation of duty in approval
Maintain audit trail of all approvals
Regular audit of access against approvals

mistakes.mistake: Permanent access without periodic review or justification
mistakes.description: Users retain utility program access indefinitely without periodic review to determine if access is still needed
root_cause: Assumption that approved access remains appropriate
mistakes.impact: Users retain access long after it is needed, increased security risk, potential for misuse, audit findings of excessive access
prevention: Establish annual review schedule for all utility program access
Require re-justification of access during review
Automatically remove access when no longer justified
Define duration of access at approval time
Implement automated removal at expiry for temporary access
Document review decisions and removed access

mistakes.mistake: No segregation of duty allowing users to approve their own access
mistakes.description: Users able to request and approve their own utility program access without independent review
root_cause: Absence of segregation of duty controls
Assumption that users will act appropriately
mistakes.impact: Users may grant themselves inappropriate access, increased misuse risk, no independent oversight, audit failure
prevention: Explicitly require segregation of duty between requester and approver
Define approval authority outside requester's chain
For small organisations, designate external approver
Audit all approvals to verify segregation of duty

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 8.18 audit

audit_areas.description: Verify documented inventory of utility programs
checks: List of utility programs identified and maintained
Program name, version and capability documented

audit_areas.description: Verify formal process for requesting and approving access
checks: Segregation of duty between requester and approver
Sample requests show required information documented

audit_areas.description: Verify requester and approver are different parties
checks: Approval authority defined and separate from users
Requests reviewed for segregation of duty
Unauthorized installations not detected on systems

audit_areas.description: Verify time limitations on access where appropriate
checks: Temporary access duration limited to business need
Access removal scheduled when duration expires
Monitoring system captures installation and usage
Audit logs show execution and activities

audit_areas.description: Verify annual review of utility program access
checks: Review evidence shows all access evaluated
Access removed if no longer justified

audit_areas.description: Verify controls on critical gambling systems
checks: Utility programs on game servers controlled
Access to payment processing tools restricted
Access to customer data utilities restricted
RNG or game modification tools properly controlled
Approval evidence for all game system access

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: For gambling operators, utility programs pose significant risk to critical systems including RNG systems, payment processing systems and customer data systems. UKGC expects that utility program access is strictly controlled with documented approval and that access is limited to trusted personnel with specific business need.
specific_requirements: Utility program access to game servers and RNG systems restricted to authorised technical personnel only
Payment processing utility tool access controlled with approval evidence
Database utility programs restricted to authorised database administrators with approval
System administration tools limited to approved IT staff with documented business justification
Access to customer data extraction or modification utilities strictly controlled
Temporary access to utility programs time-limited to specific duration
Annual review of all utility program access conducted and documented
Monitoring of utility program installation and usage implemented
Segregation of duty maintained between access request and approval
Audit trail of utility program approvals and usage maintained
ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Gambling operators must maintain strict control of utility programs capable of overriding system controls through documented request and approval processes, segregation of duty, technical installation controls, monitoring and periodic review

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Limit access to powerful system administration and security tools to authorized personnel with documented business need and approval
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: Important - utility programs pose significant risk to system integrity; controls must be tight to prevent misuse
key_principles: Access limited to identified business need
Formal request and approval process required
Segregation of duty between requester and approver
Immediate removal when no longer needed

gambling_operator_specific_guidance.game_system_protection: For gambling operators, utility programs on game servers pose critical risk to game integrity and customer trust. Access must be strictly limited to authorised technical staff with documented approval. Game modification tools, RNG access tools and game configuration utilities must be treated as highest-risk utility programs.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.payment_processing_protection: Utility programs accessing payment systems require tight control. Database tools, payment gateway utilities and fund transfer programs must be restricted to authorised personnel with documented business need.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.customer_data_protection: Access to utility programs capable of extracting customer data must be strictly controlled. Data export utilities, customer record modification tools and report generation programs should require approval from data protection personnel.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.approval_requirements: For critical systems, utility program access approval should be by CISO or Head of IT, not by system owner. For game system access, gaming operations manager should be consulted. For payment system access, finance manager should be involved in approval.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.monitoring_requirements: Monitoring of utility program usage on critical systems is essential. Game server utility program access should generate alerts for investigation. Payment system tool usage should be logged and reviewed regularly.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.audit_readiness: To be audit-ready, operators should: maintain current utility program inventory; provide evidence of approval for all access; demonstrate segregation of duty; show annual review evidence; provide monitoring logs of usage; and document all access removals.
